quotes: The 'Don't Turn Off the Lights' tour was completed in the summer of 2002, with two sold-out nights in Madison Square Garden and another two in Mexico's National Auditorium.
By 2003, Iglesias had released his seventh album, which he called 7, the second to be entirely co-written by him.
After a two-year hiatus, Iglesias released his new album Insomniac on 12 June 2007.

organizations.name: Pepsi
quotes: The Seven World Tour was sponsored by Pepsi with Iglesias featuring in a commercial alongside Britney Spears, Beyoncé and Pink and a second ad which featured Not In Love.

organizations.name: Houston Rodeo
quotes: His biggest world tour to date started with twelve shows in the United States ending with Iglesias playing at Houston Rodeo, and continued on to several countries, most of which he'd never previously visited, playing to sold-out stadiums and arenas in Australia, India, Egypt, and Singapore, before ending his tour in South Africa.

organizations.name: Tommy Hilfiger
quotes: as well as 'Ring My Bells' which had featured on the commercial for Tommy Hilfiger's True Star Men and a cover of Ringside's 'Tired of Being Sorry'.
The 'Don't Turn Off the Lights' tour was completed in the summer of 2002, with two sold-out nights in Madison Square Garden and another two in Mexico's National Auditorium.
The 'Don't Turn Off the Lights' tour was completed in the summer of 2002, with two sold-out nights in Madison Square Garden and another two in Mexico's National Auditorium.
The tour finished with a single show in the Roberto Clemente Coliseum in San Juan, Puerto Rico.
The tour finished with a single show in the Roberto Clemente Coliseum in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

His biggest world tour to date started with twelve shows in the United States ending with Iglesias playing at Houston Rodeo, and continued on to several countries, most of which he'd never previously visited, playing to sold-out stadiums and arenas in Australia, India, Egypt, and Singapore, before ending his tour in South Africa.
